page.title: 14RECREATION IN SHALBOURNE
page.content: Shalbourne is lucky in having a 2-acre {games field}in lovely rural surroun- dings, given to the village at the end of the Second World War by a lady, still living locally, who wanted to continue through sport the comradeship of wartime. Two teams play{soccer}and a local{rugby}team trains in evenings. In summer there is{cricket}and a much used hard{tennis}court. A children's play area has wendy house and swings. The field can be hired from the committee on spare days for private games, fetes etc. Sporting recreations are{fishing on the River Kennet, {riding and hunting}with several packs, and{shooting}on local farms and estates.{Gliding}is available on a hill above the village. There are many walks on public{footpaths}around. At {Bedwyn}the canal provides{fishing}and {boating;}there is also a sportsground.
